title.narrative: Lesotho Nutrition and Health System Strengthening Project

description.narrative: The objective is to increase the utilization and quality of key nutrition and health services and improve selected nutrition behaviors known to reduce stunting.

condition.narrative: Schedule 2, Section 1.A.1: By no later than one (1) month after the Effective Date, the Recipient shall establish and thereaftermaintain at all times during the implementation of the Project, a high-level steering committee, with a mandate, terms ofreference, composition and resources satisfactory to the Association (“Steering Committee”), comprising, inter alia, directorsfrom each participating sector in charge of nutrition activities.

Schedule 2, Section 1.A.2: By no later than one (1) month after the Effective Date, the Recipient shall establish and thereaftermaintain at all times during the implementation of the Project, a technical committee, with a mandate, terms of reference,composition and resources satisfactory to the Association (“Technical Committee”), headed by the director of the FNCO andcomprising, inter alia, technical experts working in various ministries, to be responsible for technical oversight of nutritionactivities under the Project and which shall be required to meet quarterly to review Project implementation progress and recommendmidcourse adjustments to the Project Implementation Unit.

Without limitation upon Sections I.A.3 above, the Recipient shall, not later than three (3) months after the Effective Date,recruit at least four (4) community liaisons officers and any additional ones as agreed between the Recipient and the Association,under terms of reference and with qualifications and experience acceptable to the Association, to be responsible for overseeing theimplementation and operation of the grievance redress mechanism at district level, including the registration of complaints, firstattempt of resolution, escalation and reporting.

title.narrative: Spontaneous deliveries as percentage of total deliveries at top referral level (QMMH)
Villages benefitting from nutrition and health services package.
Women ages 15-19 currently using a modern contraceptive method
Women ages 15-49 who took iron tablets for 90+ days during the pregnancy of the most recent birth
Pregnant women screened for anaemia before 36 weeks of gestation (percentage of 1st ANC visits)
Newborns breastfed within first hour of delivery
Hospitals which have received obstetric equipment as identified in the gap assessment
Bed occupancy rate in regional and district hospitals
Adolescents reached with youth package of services (15-19)
Annual food and nutrition multisectoral steering committees meetings held
People who have received essential health, nutrition, and population (HNP) services
Children ages 6-23 months with minimum dietary diversity
Creation and utilization of recurrent MOH budget line for quality and bonus grant financing
Health facilities certified as Level 2 or above with quality rating system
Number of facilities that have presented their Quality Improvement Plan for the semester
Number of focus group discussions at the community level to record various perceptions about the project
Active male village health workers in the Project’s area
People who have received essential health, nutrition, and population (HNP) services - Female (RMS requirement)
